sen.j: 西大路通（にしおおじどおり）は、京都市中心市街地の西部に位置する主要な南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Nishioji-dori Street, located west of the heart of Kyoto City, is one of the major north-south running streets in Kyoto City.
The Nishioji-dori Street, located west of the heart of Kyoto City, is one of the major north-south streets running streets in Kyoto City.
The Nishioji-dori Street, located west of the heart of Kyoto City, is one of the major north-south streets running in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 明治末期から大正期に掛けて行われた京都三大事業での道路拡張に続き、市区改正道路（都市計画道路）として、京都市電の敷設とともに昭和初期に開通した比較的歴史の浅い通りである。
sen.e: The street has relatively a short history; it opened in the early Showa era in a city development program (as a city planning road) involving the layout of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar on the street, following road expansion program of Kyoto big three projects the in late Meiji era and Taisho period.
sen.cmt: 京都市電 定訳不明
sen.e: The street has relatively a short history; it opened in the early Showa era in a city development program (as a city planning road) involving the layout of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar on the street, following the road expansion program which was part of Kyoto's big three projects the in late Meiji era and Taisho period.

The street has relatively a short history; it opened in the early Showa period in a city development program (as a city planning road) involving the layout of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar on the street, following the road expansion program which was part of Kyoto's big three projects in late Meiji period and Taisho period.

sen.j: 1939年（昭和14年）に北大路通-九条通が開通し、その上を走る京都市電西大路線も、未開通であった円町-白梅町がつながることによって1943年（昭和18年）に開通した。
sen.e: The section between the Kitaoji-dori Street and the Kujo-dori Street opened in 1939, and then Nishioji-sen of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar started to run on the street in 1943 with the opening of the section linking Emmachi and Hakubai-cho.

The section between the Kitaoji-dori Street and Kujo-dori Street opened in 1939, after which the Nishioji-sen of the Kyoto Municipal Streetcar commenced operation along the street in 1943 coinciding with the opening of the section linking Emmachi and Hakubai-cho.

The section between the Kitaoji-dori Street and Kujo-dori Street opened in 1939, after which the Nishioji-sen of the Kyoto Municipal Streetcar commenced operation along the street in 1943 coinciding with the opening of the section linking Enmachi and Hakubai-cho.

sen.j: （市電は、1978年（昭和53年）に廃止された。）
sen.e: (The street car was abolished in 1978.)
(The street car was abolished in 1978.)
(The street car was abolished in 1978.)

sen.j: 平安京の野寺小路にほぼ一致する。
sen.e: The street roughly follows the Nodera-koji of Heiankyo. However the two roads happened to correspond with each other in comparing today's map with the Heian era's; the Nishioji-dori Street was not developed on the basis of the Nodera-koji but built in the Showa period.

The street roughly follows Nodera-koji of Heiankyo. However the two roads happened to correspond with each other in comparing today's map with the Heian era's; the Nishioji-dori Street was not developed according to the Nodera-koji but built in the Showa period.
The street roughly follows Nodera-koji of Heiankyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: しかし昭和になってから作られたので、平安時代の地図と見比べてみてたまたま位置が一致しただけであり、野寺小路が西大路通に発展したのではない。
sen.e: However the two roads happened to correspond with each other in comparing today's map with the Heian period's; the Nishioji-dori Street was not developed according to the Nodera-koji but built in the Showa period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処"era" -> "period" に変更しました。

sen.j: 北は北大路通から南は十条通までで、北部の平野神社前以北と九条通以南は東寄りに斜めになっているが、それ以外の区間では一直線に真北を向いている。
sen.e: Between the Kitaoji-dori Street in the north and the Jujo-dori Street in the south, the street is straight and oriented due north, although the section north of Kitano-jinja Shrine in the north and the section south of the Jujo-dori Street run diagonally eastward. On the street north of Kujo, Five Mountains Send-off Bonfires can be seen in a directly north direction.

Between the Kitaoji-dori Street in the north and the Jujo-dori Street in the south, the street is straight and oriented due north, although the section north of Kitano-jinja Shrine in the north and the section south of the Jujo-dori Street run diagonally eastward. On the street north of Kujo, Five Mountains Send-off Bonfires can be seen directly north.

Between the Kitaoji-dori Street in the north and the Jujo-dori Street in the south, the street is straight and oriented due north, although the section north of Hirano-jinja Shrine in the north and the section south of the Kujo-dori Street run diagonally eastward.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 九条あたりから北では、通りから真北に、五山送り火を望むことができる。
sen.e: On the street north of Kujo, Five Mountains Send-off Bonfires can be seen directly north.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: （山陰本線高架橋など障害物のあるところは除く。）
sen.e: (unless the view is not blocked by high structures such as the elevated bridge of San'in Main Line)
sen.cmt: 高架橋 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: (unless the view is not blocked by high structures such as the elevated bridge of San'in Main Line)

sen.cmt: 文頭大文字、ピリオド補足'削除

sen.j: 右京の衰退以来、都の中心から外れ、一部を除いて豊臣秀吉が築いた御土居の外側、洛外に位置することになった。
sen.e: After an decline of Ukyo, the street became away from the heart of the city and most of the sections are located outside Odoi Fortress made by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, or in Rakugai (outside of the capital Kyoto).

After the decline of Ukyo, the street was removed from the heart of the city and most of the sections are located outside Odoi Fortress made by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, or in Rakugai (outside of the capital Kyoto).

After the decline of Ukyo, the street was removed from the heart of the city and most of the sections are located outside Odoi Fortress made by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, or in Rakugai (outside of the capital Kyoto).

sen.j: 西院（西大路四条）、西七条（西大路七条）などの交差点付近の地域名は、以前の村の名前である。
sen.e: The names of districts such as Saiin (Sai) and Nishi-Shichijo around the crossings of Nishioji-Shijo and Nishi-Shichijo come from the names when they used to be villages.
The names of districts such as Saiin (Sai) and Nishi-Shichijo around the crossings of Nishioji-Shijo and Nishi-Shichijo come from a time when the names used to refer to the villages.
The names of districts such as Saiin and Nishi-Shichijo around the crossings of Nishioji-Shijo and Nishioji-Shichijo come from a time when the names used to refer to the villages.

sen.j: 五条通から北、北大路通までがマラソン、駅伝のコースとしてよく利用される。
sen.e: Marathons or marathon relay races are often held on the street north from the Gojo-dori Street to the Kitaoji-dori Street.
Marathons or marathon relay races are often held on the street north from Gojo-dori Street to Kitaoji-dori Street.
Marathons or marathon relay races are often held on the street north from Gojo-dori Street to Kitaoji-dori Street.

sen.j: 西大路五条の西に西京極総合運動公園陸上競技場兼球技場があり、そこを起点終点とすることが多いためである。
sen.e: This is because Athletics and ball game ground, Nishikyogoku Sogo Undo Park is located west of Nishioji-gojo, where such a race often starts and finishes.
This is because the athletics and ball game ground, Nishikyogoku Sogo Undo Park is located west of Nishioji-gojo, where such races often start and finish.
This is because the athletics and ball game ground, Nishikyogoku Sogo Undo Park is located west of Nishioji-gojo, where such races often start and finish.

sen.j: 西大路通の全区間（北大路通-十条通）が、東山三条交差点を起点に東大路通、北大路通、西大路通、十条通を経て竹田街道十条交差点に至る主要地方道である京都市道181号京都環状線になっている。
sen.e: All sections of the Nishioji-dori Street (Kitaoji-dori Street - Jujo-dori Street) belong to Kyoto City Road 181 Go Kyoto Kanjosen (belt line), a principal local road, which starts from Higashiyama-sanjo Crossing and finishes at Jujo Crossing with Takeda-kaido Road via the Higashioji-dori Street, Kitaoji-dori street, Nishioji-dori Street, and Jujo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: http://web.kyoto-inet.or.jp/people/kurituka/torina.htm京都環状線 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: All sections of the Nishioji-dori Street (Kitaoji-dori Street - Jujo-dori Street) belong to Kyoto City Road 181 Go Kyoto Kanjosen (belt line), a principal local road, which starts from Higashiyama-sanjo Crossing and finishes at Jujo Crossing with Takeda-kaido Road via the Higashioji-dori Street, Kitaoji-dori street, Nishioji-dori Street, and Jujo-dori Street.

All sections of the Nishioji-dori Street (Kitaoji-dori Street - Jujo-dori Street) belong to Kyoto City Road 181 Go Kyoto Kanjosen (belt line), a principal local road, which starts from Higashiyama-sanjo Crossing and finishes at Jujo Crossing with Takeda-kaido Road via the Higashioji-dori Street, Kitaoji-dori street, Nishioji-dori Street, and Jujo-dori Street.

sen.j: 上側が北側、下側が南側。
sen.e: North is upper and south is lower.
The upper side is considered the northern portion, while the lower side is considered the southern portion.
The upper side is considered the northern portion, while the lower side is considered the southern portion.

sen.j: 左側が西側、右側が東側。
sen.e: West is on the left and east is on the right.
The left side is considered the western portion, while the right side is considered the east portion.
The left side is considered the western portion, while the right side is considered the east portion.

sen.j: 交差する道路の特記がないものは主要地方道を除く市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities excluding principal local roads.
